skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Apply Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to documents and presentations.
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains only brand color values and typography guidelines in documentation. The static scanner misidentified hex color codes (#141413, #d97757, etc.) as cryptographic algorithms and shell comments. No actual code execution, network calls, or security-sensitive operations exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: This skill provides Anthropic's official brand colors and typography guidelines for creating consistent, on-brand documents and presentations. It eliminates guesswork when applying corporate styling standards.
actual_capabilities: Provides Anthropic's official brand color palette with hex codes
Specifies typography guidelines including font families and fallbacks
Offers smart font application for headings and body text
Applies accent colors to shapes and visual elements
Supports color selection based on background contrast
limitations: Does not install fonts automatically; fonts must be pre-installed
Only applies to supported file formats (presentations, documents)
Cannot enforce brand compliance across all output types
No automated brand audit or validation features

use_cases.title: Create On-Brand Presentations
use_cases.description: Use Anthropic's brand colors and typography to create professional presentations that align with corporate identity standards.

use_cases.title: Design Consistent Documentation
use_cases.description: Apply standardized brand styling to internal and external documents to maintain visual consistency across all materials.

use_cases.title: Develop Brand-Aware AI Prompts
use_cases.description: Reference official brand guidelines when prompting AI tools to generate visuals that match Anthropic's design language.

prompt_templates.title: Apply Brand Colors to Presentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Anthropic brand guidelines to style this presentation. Apply #141413 for dark backgrounds and text, #faf9f5 for light backgrounds, and #d97757 as the primary accent color. Use Poppins font for headings and Lora for body text.

prompt_templates.title: Style Document with Accent Colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a styled document using Anthropic's brand guidelines. Include headings in Poppins font with #141413 color, body text in Lora with appropriate contrast, and use the accent colors (#6a9bcc blue, #788c5d green) for shapes and visual elements.

prompt_templates.title: Generate On-Brand Visuals
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a graphic that follows Anthropic's brand guidelines. Primary colors are #141413 (dark) and #faf9f5 (light). Accent colors are #d97757 (orange), #6a9bcc (blue), and #788c5d (green). Use Poppins for headings and Lora for body text.

prompt_templates.title: Brand Compliance Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the following document against Anthropic's brand guidelines. Check that colors match the official palette (#141413, #faf9f5, #b0aea5, #e8e6dc, #d97757, #6a9bcc, #788c5d) and typography uses Poppins for headings and Lora for body. Report any deviations.

best_practices: Always use the official hex color codes from the brand guidelines for consistent results.
Apply Poppins font to headings 24pt and larger for optimal brand recognition.
Use Lora font with Georgia fallback for body text to maintain readability.
Choose accent colors (orange, blue, green) based on the visual context and contrast requirements.
anti_patterns: Using non-brand colors that closely match but are not exact hex values from the guidelines.
Applying custom fonts without ensuring fallback fonts are available.
Ignoring background contrast when selecting text colors.
Mixing multiple accent colors arbitrarily instead of selecting based on context.

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill provides color and typography guidelines applicable to presentations, documents, and any visual content that accepts hex color codes and font specifications.

faq.question: Do I need to install fonts manually?
faq.answer: Yes. Poppins and Lora fonts should be pre-installed in your environment. The skill provides automatic fallback to Arial (headings) and Georgia (body) if custom fonts are unavailable.

faq.question: How do I choose between accent colors?
faq.answer: Use orange (#d97757) for primary accents, blue (#6a9bcc) for secondary elements, and green (#788c5d) for tertiary or success-related visuals. Rotate based on visual variety needs.

faq.question: Can I use these colors for web content?
faq.answer: Yes. The hex color codes work in any web context, CSS, design tools, or applications that accept standard color specifications.

faq.question: What contrast ratios should I maintain?
faq.answer: Use #141413 (dark) on #faf9f5 (light) backgrounds for maximum contrast. The secondary color #b0aea5 works best on dark backgrounds as subtle text or borders.

faq.question: Does this skill enforce brand compliance automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides guidelines and reference values. Users must apply the colors and typography manually based on the provided specifications.
